content.title: Neon Dreams and Ancient Echoes: The Ultimate Tokyo Backpacking Guide
content.introduction: Tokyo is not just a city; it is an entire universe contained within a metropolis. From the chaotic energy of Shibuya Crossing to the profound stillness of the Meiji Shrine, it rewards those who explore its layered neighborhoods with endless surprises and world-class culinary experiences.

author.name: The Explorer Editorial
author.bio: Specializing in immersive city guides for modern adventurers.

sections.title: Things to Do
sections.content: Exploring Tokyo requires a balance of the high-tech and the historical.

items.name: Shibuya Crossing
items.description: Witness the world's busiest intersection and find a quiet cafe overlooking the chaos.

items.name: TeamLab Borderless
items.description: Immerse yourself in digital art installations that redefine the museum experience.

items.name: Tsukiji Outer Market
items.description: Start your day with the freshest sushi and street food in Japan's most iconic market.

sections.title: Where to Stay
sections.content: Choose Shinjuku for nightlife, or Asakusa for a more traditional atmosphere and budget-friendly hostels.

sections.title: Food
sections.content: From standing ramen bars in underground stations to Michelin-starred sushi in Ginza.

sections.title: Budget
sections.content: Expect to spend $50-70 per day as a backpacker, or $150+ for mid-range comfort.

sections.title: Transport
sections.content: The Tokyo Metro is incredibly efficient. Get a Pasmo or Suica card for seamless travel.

practicalTips.connectivity: Excellent Wi-Fi; pocket Wi-Fi or eSIM is highly recommended.
practicalTips.hiddenGem: The miniature bars of Golden Gai in Shinjuku.
